Is this the command you ran <denchmark-code>curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/latest |\ grep browser_download |\ grep $opsys |\ cut -d '"' -f 4 |\ xargs curl -O -L && \ tar -zvxf kfctl_*_${opsys}.tar.gz </denchmark-code>
I suspect there is a bug in that serious of scripts and it ends up not getting the URL correctly. I'd suggest just going to the releases page and downloading the release you need <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases</denchmark-link>
Sorry about this. I verified it on Ubuntu and Mac. I assumed it would work with CentOS as well. Shall I remove the script from the page?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/swiftdiaries>@swiftdiaries</denchmark-link> I think so. Script is error prone as binaries might not available in all platforms.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/krishnadurai>@krishnadurai</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/swiftdiaries>@swiftdiaries</denchmark-link> what should we do to close this issue out? Should we try to fix the script or should we just update the docs to tell people to manually download it rather than executing some script?
It would be better to have the website point to the releases page and the users manually download it. I'll shortly open a PR to address the same.
